FLAMES RIP THROUGH FREDDY/JASON. THE TWO MEN ARE
HOOKS AND LARGE JAGGED BLADES WHICH PLUNGE THEMSELVES
THE TANK AND THE ADJACENT TANKS OF PROPANE _EXPLODE_. THE
DIRECTLY DOWN INTO THE MECHANISM, SHREDDING THEIR ANKLES
HALF-OUT OF JASON'S CHEST. THE TWO MEN HAVE BEEN FUSED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful mountain landscape. Pine trees, snow-capped  mountains and a clear blue, lovely lake nestled amidst it all. CAMERA PANS down to reveal an old wooden sign that  says "CAMP CRYSTAL LAKE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first thing we're gonna do is  change that fucking name. MOVE TO REVEAL a man and a woman. The man is KEN BILLER - early forties, slick clothing, a lot of money. The woman, JANET DAVENPORT, is in her twenties and wears a chic  business suit. She's a Realtor and is holding an armful  of papers and documents. She looks dubious at Biller's  idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think the people who live  around here would like that very  much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they like the fact that  tourism has dropped ninety-eight  percent in the last ten years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you think they like the fact  that half the country thinks Crystal  Lake is filled with corpses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not talking about truth, we're  talking about perception.  And the perception is that Crystal  Lake means inbred psychopaths running  around the hills with axes and hockey  masks chopping up teenagers. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, my dear, is what we call an  _image problem_. The woman can't argue with this -- it's a familiar story. Biller starts strolling down the dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky I'm up here at all. Most  of my investors think I'm crazy. As she moves to catch up to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biller and Janet walking through the deep woods. She's  checking the map, trying to keep track of where they are, while Biller strides forth confidently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful trees... sturdy trunks...  lots of branches... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do some great logging up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logging? We'll need an environmental  impact study for that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're getting in the  spirit of things, Janet. We'll buy  whatever studies we need -- Suddenly a DEER bolts from the brush and takes off in the forest. It's a jarring moment and Biller nearly jumps out of his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a deer, Mister Biller. Part of  the local wildlife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stern)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of them. Janet looks dubious -- isn't sure what to say. Biller  glances around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen enough. It's getting dark...  let's head back. Janet looks at the map with a little anxiety... she's not quite sure where they are but doesn't want to admit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... well... I think it's this  way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. He takes off and she follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's now nearly DARK. Biller is striding through the  forest, Janet trying to consult the map in the fading  light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people wouldn't have this image  problem if you didn't let all those  Hollywood types come up here and film  slasher movies. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homicidal maniacs may sell movie  tickets, but they don't sell vacation  getaways. Janet finally stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Biller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... but we left the main  trail... and I can't find any  landmarks around here... I've been  trying to figure it out but... Biller seems unfazed by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we ask _them_? He points to something over Janet's shoulder. She turns  to follow his gaze, and in the distance we can see what  looks like an old, run-down HOUSE. It's covered with  vines, bushes, tall grass -- the building is only barely  discernable through the forest. Janet frowns at the  sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think there were any houses  up here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You learn something new every day.  Let's go. They head toward the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house was obviously nice at one time, but has been  abandoned for many years.  The forest has crept in on the grounds and has almost  reclaimed the house itself -- trees, shrubs, weeds are  everywhere. Biller and Janet walk up to the front porch.  Janet looks over the house with some concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like anyone's lived here  for years... Biller turns around and glances back at the way they  came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... look at that view.

dialogues.speaker: LAKE
dialogues.text: revealing that from this vantage, a vista of Crystal Lake is visible with the setting sun glistening across it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is prime real estate. I want it.  Who owns the house? Janet is shuffling papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... there's no listing of  a private residence in this area. Biller is inspecting the house with interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Structure might be salvageable...  let's see what the interior looks  like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Biller... now that we can see  the lake, I think we should follow the  shoreline to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me with this. Biller is trying to pull off one of the boards that's  nailed across the front door. Janet reluctantly helps  him, and the two of them wrench the board off with a  great effort. Biller tries the door -- it's unlocked but  the door is swollen with age. He kicks at it to force it  open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door crashes OPEN, letting in the soft, golden  light of dusk. Biller and Janet enter and peer around  what was once the living room of the house. The windows  are all boarded shut, letting in only a few random  streams of light from outside. The only pieces of  furniture visible are a single upholstered CHAIR sitting  in the middle of the room. Both are covered with grime  and dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew! What's that smell? Biller walks up to a wall, thumps it soundly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walls are in good shape. Janet hesitates at the doorway, not wanting to come  inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There doesn't seem to be any water  damage. Kind of cozy, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really think we should go back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to look at the rest of the  house. Biller moves off into another room. Janet pushes her  fears aside and walks slowly into the living room, almost afraid to touch anything. She swipes a finger across the  mantle, leaving a trail through a thick layer of dust.  She glances down at the chair... there is an IMPRINT of a person in the layer of dust, as though someone was  recently sitting there. Janet frowns, curious... then walks into a nearby  HALLWAY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biller is looking around the room. It's dirty, and  obviously hasn't been used in a long time, but on one  countertop we see a large WHITESTONE -- a sharpening  stone for knives. He eyes it curiously... reaches up and  opens a large cupboard directly above the countertop.  Inside is a vast collection of KNIVES, which gleam  brightly in the dim light -- everything from bowie knives to steaks knives to machetes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. He carefully takes out a large BUTCHER KNIFE. The blade  is pristine and razor sharp. He eyes it and is about to  test the sharpness of the edge with his thumb, when  suddenly there is a loud CHIRPING SOUND. Biller is  startled and slices the ball of his thumb on the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: _Shit_! Biller quickly realizes it's just his CELLULAR PHONE  ringing. He sucks on his thumb and jams the knife down  into a butcher block. Biller then pulls the cell phone  out of his jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken, it's Bruce. Listen, we've got a  nibble on the Pendleton financing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? How much? Over this dialogue, Biller continues to look around the  kitchen. He opens a walk-in clost -- inside is a  collection of MEAT HOOKS, all neatly arranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty? We need seventy-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken, we've been through this... Biller slides out a large cutting board that's inset into the counter. It's stained with a deep, dark reddish color -- what might be blood. Biller barely notices, slides it  shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet enters and looks around the eerie room. Everything  has been perfectly preserved -- the bed is neatly made,  photographs are neatly arranged on tabletops, etc. The  DUST all over is thick -- it doesn't look like anything's been touched for years. She walks up to a night table next to the bed... sees an  old black-and-white photograph sitting there. She picks  it up...

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: It shows a YOUNG BOY, about eleven years-old, sitting on  the front steps of the house. The boy is staring directly into the camera with a vacant, haunted look.

dialogues.speaker: JANET
dialogues.text: who for reasons she cannot name is a little disturbed by  the photo. She sets it down and turns away... She continues to walk around the room... stops at a  dresser, which is cluttered with junk and things that  look like they've been shoved aside. As she cautiously  starts to sort through the clutter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As before, Biller snooping around, on the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell them if they come up to  seventy-five, I'll cut them in on the  Crystal Lake package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you're still thinking of  buying Casa de Psycho...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, smart-ass, I'm up here right now  in a... luxury alpine retreat, with a  two million dollar view of the lake. As he speaks, he opens the door to a broom closet,  glances inside and closes it... then does a double-take  and looks inside again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we have to do is put in... There are FOUR CHAIN SAWS of various sizes hanging in the closet. He reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chain saws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to put in chain saws?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... listen, when I get back to  New York we'll meet with the Board. He walks up to the door of a PANTRY... grabs hold of the  handle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Pendleton to wait until we've had  the meeting. They'll give us seventy- five... He opens the pantry door and steps inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm telling you, this lake is a  gold mine waiting to -- Hanging on a wall hook is a dirty pair of coveralls...  and a _HOCKEY MASK_. He reacts to the sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet is poking through the junk on the dresser, when she sees a pile of yellowed newspaper clippings lying on the  floor. She bends down to examine them... HEADLINES: "Boy Drowns at Crystal Lake." "Mother Blames  Counselors for Death of Son." "Teenaged Counselors  Murdered at Crystal Lake." "Hollywood Plans Movie About  Crystal Lake Slayings - City Council Hopes for Economic  Boom." Janet shuffles through the clippings for a few moments,  then suddenly hears a series of loud THUMPS from  somewhere in the house. She drops the clippings, stands  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Biller? Silence. Worried, she exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's DARK now. Janet enters and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Biller...? We hear a small, faint voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faint)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Can anyone hear me? Hello? She heads toward the kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet walks in, finds the source of the voice -- it's  Biller's cell phone lying on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anybody there? She picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Janet Davenport -- I'm the  Realtor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Ken? Is he all right? Janet is definitely getting nervous now. She glances  around the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that other guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freezes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ken said there was another guy  there... _big_ guy... then he dropped  the phone. What's going on? Her breath is coming faster now. She grabs the butcher  knife seen earlier out of the butcher block for  protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but I'm outta here. She opens what she thinks is the back door, but it's  actually the walk-in closet. She screams at what she sees inside -- Biller is HANGING FROM A MEAT HOOK -- DEAD. Janet bolts for the Living Room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet races to the front door, which is now _closed_. She tries to open it but it's locked. She pounds, pulls on it with all her strength but it's no use. She turns around  wild-eyed, then freezes at something she sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting calmly in the chair in the middle of the living  room is a large, hulking figure of a man. It's _JASON  VOORHEES_. He's wearing the hockey mask and seems to be  watching her in the dim light. Janet stares at him,  frozen in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet, are you okay? Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely able to talk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He... he's here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there? Janet lifts the knife as if to ward off Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god... this is his house...  _we're in his fucking house_...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janet, goddamnit, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jas... Jason Voorhees... he's here... Jason calmly watches her. After a few seconds, he slowly  and deliberately rises up out of the chair... and as he  does, the following happens in the blink of an eye: -- Janet hurls the knife at Jason in desperation... -- The knife flashes through the air... -- Jason's hands whips up, plucks the knife out of the  air and _flings it straight back at Janet in one single  motion_. -- The knife flashes back across the room, the blade  gleaming in the light. It PLUNGES deep into Janet's  forehead and KNOCKS her off her feet.

dialogues.speaker: THE CELL PHONE
dialogues.text: hits the floor with a spray of blood. The impact closes  the flip phone and it comes to a rest against the wall.  The display screen says the word "END." But the phone is still active. A small, green light  continues to blink on and off. As we PUSH IN on the tiny  green light, we hear the sound of a TELEPHONE  CONVERSATION, starting with the ringing of a phone.  Someone picks up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine-One-One Emergency. How can I help  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah... my name's Bruce Kelly.  Listen, I think two people may have  been killed up at Crystal Lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you say that, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON a rack of shotguns. As we continue to listen to  the VOICEOVERS, we see someone unlocking the weapons  locker and DEPUTIES start grabbing shotguns two at a  time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Nine-One-One dispatch to  Crystal Lake Sheriff's Department. We  have a Code Red in progress, location  unknown. Recommend tracking cellular  phone which we believe to be still  active. Cell phone number is...

dialogues.speaker: NEW IMAGE
dialogues.text: Several DEPUTIES loading weapons, duffel bags, and  assault equipment into the back of the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? FBI Tactical Response Team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this is Sheriff Hayes up at  Crystal Lake. I think you boys better  get up here. We got him this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is quiet. No signs of activity. Suddenly, TEN MEN IN  DARK CLOTHING carrying assault weapons appear out of the  forest like phantoms and creep toward the house. Their  moves are efficient, quick -- men trained in military  tactics. We FOLLOW ONE AGENT all the way to the front  door, where he pauses, listens to his radio earpiece for  a moment, then touches his throat-mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Charlie-One. We've reaced  Center-ice. He checks his weapon, glances to his teammates, who each  give him a nod. HE KICKS OPEN THE DOOR --

dialogues.speaker: A TELEPHONE
dialogues.text: A standard phone, ringing loudly. A woman sits up in bed  and grabs the phone out of its cradle. Her name is RUBY  JARVIS -- mid-twenties, pretty, out on her own for the  first time since law school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm awake. The voice on the phone -- KEITH HARDING -- is excited,  borderline hysterical, a torrent of words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby, it's Keith Harding from the  D.A.'s office. You have to get down  here. We need a public defender right  away. She glances at a clock nearby -- it says 3:07 am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the Sheriff's department just  brought him in ten minutes ago, and I  want this one to go by the numbers. I  don't want any Miranda problems on  appeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... all right. I'll be there  in twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it ten. Bye. Ruby stumbles out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... who's the defendant?  Who am I defending? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: _Jason Voorhees_. OFF Ruby's shocked reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small-town Sheriff's Station that has become the scene  of tremendous activity. A dozen squad cars in the parking lot... a van that says "FBI Tactical Response Team" on  the side... some sheriff's deputies milling about in SWAT gear... an ambulance nearby. Some deputies with serious  injuries are being attended to by medics.  Ruby pulls up in her car just as a news van comes to a  screeching halt nearby. A FEMALE REPORTER and a CAMERAMAN jump out -- the reporter also looks like she just got out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cameraman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banks says we're going to CNN live in  less than five minutes. We'll do a  stand-up here in front of the  station... get the sat-link on-  line... Ruby walks through the scene of chaos... at the front  door there are TWO OFFICERS in SWAT gear guarding the  door. They stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Ruby Jarvis. Counsel for the  Defense. The officers exchange an amused look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: _You_... are going to defend _him_? They chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're good. Ruby brushes past them in annoyance and goes inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an air of excitement in the small office. Through a window partition, we can see Deputies in the b.g,  typing out reports, talking on the phone, moving  equipment and coordinating various tasks. In the office  itself, SHERIFF HAYES is sitting behind his desk, facing  an FBI AGENT and KEITH HARDING, the District Attorney.  The mood is tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to FBI Agent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if he's on the FBI's most  wanted List. I don't care if he's been  on "America's Most Wanted."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Agent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's committed dozens of murders in  this County, and we're going to  prosecute him here first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. I can have a  Federal writ down here by morning  superseding all -- There's a knock at the door. They all turn as Ruby walks  in. There is an easy familiarity around the room -- this  is a small town and everyone here knows each other and  works together often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hayes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bill. Hayes stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to pull you out of bed, Ruby.  Let me introduce Agent Parsons of the  FBI... he'll be handling the Federal  part of the case. Ruby shakes        his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby        Jarvis -- Public Defender's  Office.  Keith Harding, the D.A. and her adversary in this case,  smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She _is_ the office. She's the only  P.D. within fifty miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handled a murder case before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I'd call them murder  exactly. More like a couple of bar  fights that got out of hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seem to recall arguing the same  thing in court while you were trying  to file murder-one charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job. The FBI Agent turns to Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counselor, this case is going to be  tried in Federal Court.  I'll have a writ here in the morning  to that effect, so I wouldn't lose too  much sleep worrying about your  defense. The Federal court will  appoint a Federal attorney for Mister  Voorhees. Ruby smiles, smooth as silk. She's ready for this...  hands him a legal document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was looking over your arrest  warrant... and I noticed it was signed  by Judge Gillan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess... I didn't handle that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should have. You see, Judge  Gillan is the Superior Court  Magistrate. This is a _Federal_  warrant. The FBI agent looks a little disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This arrest warrant is completely  invalid. You'll have to get a new  warrant signed by a Federal circuit  court Judge. As the FBI Agent looks over the document, Harding moves  over to Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ruby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just like to point out that my  arrest warrant is properly signed and  dated... so Voorhees is _not_ walking  free. The Agent looks up at Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Who's the circuit court judge  for this district?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be Judge Hobson. And he  just left on a two week fishing trip. Ruby smiles at him pleasantly. The FBI Agent gets red-  faced with anger and frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot shot, huh? If you're so good, what  are you doing here in Mayberry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing the rest of us are doing.  Going down to Floyd's barber shop for  a trim... fucking farm animals... the  usual.         The FBI Agent looks disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't heard the last of this. He exits. Hayes and Harding smile at Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fun to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you one of those girls that  always had her homework done two days  before the teacher asked for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my client?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your... client is being booked right  now. He'll be in cell five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the charges?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. We're still putting the victim  list together. You'll need a forklift  for the case file. I suggest you hire  some help, and don't expect to get a  lot of sleep for the next few months. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about to defend the most  notorious serial killer in American  history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that was Ted Bundy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compared to this guy... amateur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small town jail facility with five cells total. Ruby  and Sheriff Hayes are walking toward the end of the tiny  cell block. At the very end of the hall there are TWO  DEPUTIES armed with shotguns, wearing bullet-proof vests, standing nervously by a cell. Ruby is keeping a neutral,  even expression on her face -- but it hides a genuine  nervousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Wasn't on any of the  maps... we could barely see it through  the underbrush. Place must've been  abandoned for twenty years.  They come to the cell at the end of the hall, and Ruby  gets her first glimpse of her client.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: who is sitting on a prison bed, wearing jail house  clothes.  His arms and legs have been shackled and he looks like he couldn't move even if he wanted to. Jason's head is bowed and he's staring at the floor, most of his features  obscured by shadow, but we can tell that his head and  face are disfigured by numerous scars. (NOTE: This is not the hideously deformed mutant seen in  the other Jason movies, but a real man. He's no less  frightening, however, and he bears the scars of countless fights and wounds.)

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: takes in a breath, a little disturbed just by being this  close to him. Hayes takes note of her reaction, but keeps his eyes on Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... everyone feels that way when  they see him... something's not right  about this guy.  Ruby gives him a sharp look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just a man, Sheriff. A man that  needs to talk to his attorney...  alone. The Deputies exchange a look -- is she crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby... this guy almost took out an  entire Tactical Response Team. You  can't expect me to just leave you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't look like he's going  anywhere, Bill. And if necessary, I  can get a judicial order reaffirming  the right of my client to speak to his  attorney in private. Hayes gives her a disgusted look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Have a pleasant conversation...  but I wouldn't get too close if I were  you.  Hayes nods to the Deputies, who open the jail cell door  for Ruby. She takes a confident step inside and then they SLAM the door closed behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scream if you need anything. Hayes and the Deputies go down the hall and exit to the  Sheriff's Station, leaving Ruby alone. Once they are  gone, some of the bravado leaves her countenance. She's  standing four feet away from the one and only _Jason_.  There's a tense beat and then she opens her file folder  and tries to proceed normally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Voorhees... my name is Ruby  Jarvis. I've been appointed by the  court to act as your defense counsel.  Is that acceptable to you? Jason never even stirs. Throughout the scene he remains  motionless, staring down at the floor. Ruby is frightened of this man... repelled by his appearance and his  chilling demeanor. She tries to do her job, but it isn't easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you object, I'm going to take  that as a yes. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Mister Voorhees, you're  going to be charged with multiple  homicides, which under laws of this  state make you eligible for the death  penalty. Do you understand? No response. She takes a beat, then sits across from him  on the cot, and takes another tack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... there's a lot of evidence  against you... and there's a lot of  people who would like to see you get  the chair. But I'm not one of them. My  job is to help you. That means, right  now, I'm your only friend. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be very hard to defend  you if you won't talk to me. Jason just sits there. Ruby takes a nervous breath --  this clearly isn't getting anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be an arraignment in three  days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to enter a plea. Guilty or  not guilty. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you object... I'm going to  enter a plea on your behalf. After the  arraignment, we'll have to plan our --  Jason suddenly MOVES his arm and the chains RATTLE  loudly. Ruby bolts up off the bed in terror and leans up  against the bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard! An anxious beat... then we see that Jason was only  lifting his arm to scratch his other hand. The two  Deputies come racing in with shotguns at-the-ready. Ruby  stands there for a moment, heart pounding... then she  picks up her files as if nothing's wrong and turns toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to sound calm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... ready to leave. One of the Deputies looks at her, not sure what happened  but satisfied that Jason isn't doing anything at the  moment. He unlocks the door. As Ruby exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small office overflowing with paperwork, files, the  general clutter of an overworked civil servant. Ruby is  pacing while her assistant, DANNY KWAN, an eager man in  his early 20's, with a ponytail, furiously scribbles  notes on a yellow legal pad as Ruby talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to file a motion for a change of venue, and sequestration of  the jury. And I want to try _habeas  corpus_. I know we don't have much of  a chance for that, but let's give it a  shot anyway.  Kwan scribbles a few notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to plead insanity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's our best bet. They're  taking apart his house right now...  they found weapons, blood, a mountain  of evidence. We can't say he was  framed. She thinks furiously. It's obvious that this is an  impossible case to defend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.is kind of a nightmare case,  isn't it? If there's anyone who  deserves to get the chair, it's Jason. She whirls on him, her voice suddenly harsh. Kwan has  accidently struck an emotional chord in Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that around me ever again.  We're his attorneys. We have a duty to  defend him -- not judge him. Remember  that, Danny, or you won't be on this  case much longer.  Kwan is taken aback... he didn't expect this kind of  reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening a little)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... we're going to need a really  good head-doctor for this. Someone who  can get up on the stand and tell the  jury that our client is mentally  insane and has been for years... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go through a dozen doctors  before we find one who's willing to  testify for us.  She gets a thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... we should call Joe Sena. Kwan gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know... he's a little wacky,  but he's the best psycho-neurologist  in the state. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him down here by morning. I want  him to interview Jason tomorrow  afternoon. Kwan nods, flips the page on his notepad to a clean one.  Ruby glances at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... I think the video store's open  for another couple of hours. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Video store? OFF his puzzled look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A local place. Ruby's car is parked out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby and Kwan enter the store at a brisk pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to argue every possible  defense in this case. Insanity...  incompetence... and the fact that  Jason can't get a fair trial anywhere  in the country, much less this state. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the horror section?  Kwan points and they head in that direction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they round the corner and head into the Horror  section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... why can't Jason get a fair  trial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because everyone knows he's guilty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. Jason can't get a fair trial  because of _these_. She indicates the wall of videotapes boxes. The covers  are all lurid -- lots of images of killers with knives,  axes and chain saws chasing scantily-clad women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the past fifteen years, Jason  Voorhees has been portrayed as a brutal, remorseless killer. People have a preconceived notion of  his guilt based on these movies. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I intend to enter these films into  evidence... and argue that media  saturation has prejudiced my client's  right to a fair trial. Kwan gives her a sidelong look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that's going to work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if anything's going to  work in this case. Therefore, we have  to try everything.  She eyes the countless movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know where to begin... Kwan pipes in, revealing himself to be the quintessential horror film buff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd start with "Friday The  Thirteenth." 1980. Director: Sean  Cunningham. A breakthrough picture  that set the standard for the movies  to follow. The gore and high body  count made this slasher film an  instant classic. Ruby looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch this garbage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a legitimate cinematic genre.  Just like Westerns, Comedies, Film  Noire, Science Fiction... She picks out a title at random, reads it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Zombie Sluts From Beyond the Grave."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seminal film. First ever depiction  of a fully nude triple impalement. Ruby sighs, starts grabbing tapes off the shelf...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest house on a tree-lined suburban street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A TELEVISION SCREEN which is showing a horror  movie. A young TEENAGE GIRL wearing a transparent  negligee is walking down a staircase in a dark, spooky  house. She looks frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny... Johnny, is that you?  No answer. She walks into the living room...

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE RUBY
dialogues.text: who is lying in bed wearing a bathrobe, legal documents  scattered on the bed and stacks of videos nearby. She's trying to take notes on a legal pad, but she's  having trouble getting into these movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not Johnny.  It's Jason, and he's going to put a  fucking axe in your skull, so turn on  the fucking _lights_. On the TV, we see the girl reach the bottom of the  stairs... look around the darkened living room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is everybody? Johnny, this isn't  funny... She hears a NOISE from behind a closet door. She heads  toward it. Ruby looks exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go in there. Why are you going  in there? The girl slowly opens the creaky door... suddenly a CAT  jumps out! It startles the girl, who screams. But then  she realizes it was only the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluffy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (predicting, bored)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's behind the door... The girl onscreen relaxes, smiles, nothing to worry  about. She swings the door closed and behind the door is  a huge man in a hockey mask. Jason! He swings a giant axe toward the girl. Ruby grabs the remote control and fast- forwards through the action -- Jason chopping up the girl at triple speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah... he chops you up... but  you know what? You deserved it. She ejects the movie, tosses it aside and grabs another  title. She pops it in the VCR and hits play. On the TV,  we see the title of the movie appear -- "Friday the  Thirteenth, Part 10 -- Jason's Greatest Hits and Chops."  Ruby shakes her head, leans back on the bed and begins  writing on the pad... We hear a THUMP somewhere in the  house. Ruby pauses and looks up... did she imagine it? Silence.  There's a second THUMP. This time she sits up -- that was definitely something. She hits pause on the remote,  stands up and walks out of the bedroom into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby walks into the shadowy room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...        is somebody there? She walks through the house a moment... play the tension  for a few beats... and suddenly the PHONE RINGS. Ruby  almost jumps out of her skin. She snaps up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? On the other end, we hear a panicked Sheriff Hayes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby, he's gone. He got out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason. Jason's gone. He broke out of  jail about an hour ago.  Ruby reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... what are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got deputies combing the area.  But he was last seen heading in your  general direction. I want you to -- The phone clicks off and goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... Sheriff? Hello? She starts punching buttons on the phone -- no effect.  Suddenly there's another THUMP! somewhere in the room.  Ruby backs up and drops the phone, breathing faster now.  She steels herself, then takes a quiet step towards the  closet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there? A rattle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, goddamnit, if this is your idea  of a joke... She slowly moves towards the closet... opens the door...  There's a loud MEOW. A CAT is sitting on the floor in the closet. Ruby takes a breath of relief, picks up the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluffy. She hesitates...        then frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... _I don't have a cat_. We hear the TAP, TAP, TAP of a walking stick on  cobblestones. Ruby turns --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby's living room is now filled with FOG. Surreal  moonlight filters in. In the distance we can hear the  deep CHIMING of a clock tower; and an old, gaslamp street light is sitting in the middle of the room. It almost  looks like old LONDON. Her furniture is still present,  but instead of carpet there are cobblestones on the  floor.  The cat HISSES at something off camera and runs away.  Ruby watches in astonishment as the figure of a MAN  wearing a hat and cloak appears out of the mist. He has a walking CANE, which he taps on the stones as he  approaches...  She watches him as he steps into the street lamp's glow.  His face is ghastly pale, eyes dark and murderous. We  should recognize him as JACK THE RIPPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (British accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, my dear. How about a tumble  with old Jack? He whips off the top of the cane, revealing a razor-  sharp stiletto blade hidden inside. He jumps toward her  and she recoils. She stumbles backward, goes through the  door to the bathroom, slams it behind her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is a bizarre cross between a bathroom and a  bleak cement PRISON CELL. There's a BUZZING SOUND. Ruby  looks down to see a MAN etching a Swastika onto her shin  with an electric tattoo gun. The man looks up at her, and we can see from his long, stringy hair, beard and  distinctive Swastika in the middle of his forehead, that  this must be CHARLES MANSON.  He smiles up at her. She pulls away. He comes at her,  laughing that maniacal laugh. She turns, and as she  does...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's standing in front of her own stove. There's  something bubbling in a large pot. She lifts the lid to  find HUMAN BODY PARTS boiling in the cauldron -- a hand,  an eye, a foot.  She drops the lid in horror. A MAN GRABS her from behind. He's a tall, lanky man with short blonde hair and wire- frame glasses. It's JEFFREY DAHMER. He has a butcher  knife in his hand.  She pulls away -- runs right into ANOTHER MAN. This one  is dressed as a CIRCUS CLOWN. JOHN WAYNE GACEY. He gives  her a hideous smile, grabs her by the arms and throws her down onto the kitchen counter. He leans over her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dahmer, the Ripper, Gacey, Manson all closing in on her.  Suddenly they stop, turn... look behind them... and part  to allow someone else to step forward...  JASON VOORHEES steps directly towards Ruby, wearing the  hockey mask, carrying a machete.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: watches in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason, no... please... NO!  Jason pulls the hockey mask away, revealing the shocking  face of _FREDDY KRUEGER_. She freezes at the sight of  him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason? (sneers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: _Amateur_. He raises his hand, which now has the familiar finger  blades on it...  The blades gleam in the moonlight, and as his hand swoops toward her face we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ruby _wakes up_ with a scream on her couch. The legal  pad is still in her lap... the first movie still playing  on the TV. It shows Jason stalking a young victim.  She looks startled and frightened by the nightmare. After a beat, she picks up the remote and turns off the TV. As  she lays back on the bed, catching her breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of days later. Crowds have gathered... media  vans and satellite dishes in place... sheriff's deputies  trying to keep the crowd contained... people with signs  proclaiming, "Jason Must Die!"... others that say, "Free  Jason!"... Journalists and camera crews jockeying for  position. A few people selling tee-shirts. It's the Trial of the Century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In contrast to the pandemonium outside, the courtroom is  relatively subdued. The visitor's gallery is packed, but  everyone is keeping their voices low, speaking in hushed  tones. Ruby and Kwan are at the Defense table, going over her  legal briefs, as Harding enters through a side door. He's dressed like something out of GQ -- very snappy. He moves to the prosecutor's table, puts his briefcase down, then  moves over to have a few words with Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CNN... all five networks... Court  TV... two Japanese networks... three  from the UK... and one guy who swears  he's from Zimbabwe. Ruby gives an absent nod, concentrates on the file in  front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're in the center ring. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you want to wear that blazer? She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about to be a media darling --  you might want to dress the part. She rolls her eyes at him. Harding goes over to his side  of the table. A man comes through the crowd and sits  himself on the edge of the table in front of Ruby. This  is JOE SENA, the psychiatrist/neurologist. Early 30's,  good-looking, smart and he knows it. His complete  confidence in himself is sometimes perceived as  arrogance. Ruby looks up, and we can tell she knows him - and is a little wary of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Sena... did you complete your  examination of Jason?  Sena nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fucking nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Is that what you're going to  say when I put you on the stand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. When you put me on the stand, I'll  say your client is catatonic and  exhibits classic symptoms of a  schizophrenic, sociopathic  personality. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he doesn't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesnit sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insomnia. Not unusual for someone in  his situation. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention he's a bed-wetter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wets the bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always throw that in. It makes the  jury feel sorry for the defendant. Ruby looks annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we prove any of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prove it? Come on, the guy's an  avocado. He doesn't say a word, he  doesn't move, he doesn't respond to  any external stimuli... You can say  anything you want about him, but you  can't prove it one way or another. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the outlook's not entirely grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the deputies is pretty cute. I  think she likes me. Ruby ignores this -- she's familiar with Sena's  escapades. She sits back in the chair, a little  frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bad, Joe. The Prosecution is  already putting together a team of  psychiatric specialists. They'll argue  exactly the opposite. They'll say he's  just pretending to be catatonic and  he's completely sane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Battling head doctors. We'll  confuse the jury enough to create a  reasonable doubt. Hung jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jason Voorhees. They'll be  looking for an excuse to send him to  the chair. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're going to argue insanity,  we're going to need something a little  more concrete. Sena thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... we can look for earlier  evidence of psychotic or sociopathic  behavior in his childhood, but I'll  need access to his medical-- Suddenly there's a gasp that goes around the room and  everyone stops talking. Ruby looks up to see so being led in by six deputies, heavily armed. Jason is shackled and  shuffles across the courtroom, finally being seated at  the defense table. In the harsh light of day, Jason's  scarred and twisted features are shocking -- it looks  like he's been through a meat-grinder. Again, Jason seems passive, staring off into middle-distance, completely  disconnected from the world around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All rise. The Superior Court for the  city and county of Crystal Lake is now  in session. Honorable Judge Gillan  presiding. Everyone stands as the JUDGE enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be seated. Everyone sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one case on the docket, Your  Honor. "The People versus Jason  Voorhees."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will the defendant please rise during the reading of the charges.  Ruby stands and hesitates, afraid to touch Jason, who  isn't moving a muscle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, my client... prefers to  remain seated. The Judge peers at Jason in curiosity, then decides not  to press the matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. (to Harding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the People ready to proceed? Harding stands, holding a thick legal document the size  of a phone book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Your Honor. The People make the  following charges against the  defendant Jason no-middle-initial  Voorhees... (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Friday, May thirteenth, 1980, the  defendant did with malice and  forethought murder Annie Wolfe with a  bowie knife. The People further charge  on that same date, defendant did  murder Dorothy Dartland with an axe.  On the following morning, the  defendant murdered Jack Hayes with a  bow and arrow...  As Harding continues to talk, reading off what seems an  endless series of victims, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.        Harding still reading from the endless vict list, people shifting a little restlessly in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defendant did then murder Robert Smith  with a tent pole on February twelfth,  1984... defendant is further charged  with the murder of Lynn Kaplan with a  pitchfork...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much later, Harding finishes up the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally, most recently Federal  Agent Sam McNulty, a law enforcement  officer for the Federal Bureau of  Investigation, strangled by the  defendant while        resisting arrest. Harding closes the massive file. Relief around the  courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That concludes the State's charges,  Your Honor. The Judge takes a long breath... looks to Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the Defense ready to enter a plea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are, Your Honor. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Defense pleads... _not guilty_. Reactions of disbelief around the courtroom, snickers and outright laughter, it sounds so ridiculous. The Judge  raps his gavel with disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order... order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Defense would like to move for a  change of venue. We feel that it will  be impossible to find an impartial  jury in Crystal Lake County or -- Suddenly a MAN stands up in the courtroom -- his face  contorted with rage and anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed my sister, you son of a  bitch! You _fucking monster_! He pulls out a handgun and FIRES at Jason. People dive  for cover.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: as the BULLETS catch him full in the chest, knocking him  out of his chair. The spectators are screaming and  crying. The Judge ducks behind his bench. Sheriff's  deputies finally wrestle the man to the ground. Ruby  crawls over to Jason, who is lying motionless on the  floor, blood pooling nearby. He's conscious, his eyes-  staring around the room with a stunned look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need an ambulance, _now_!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swirl of activity as an ER DOCTOR and NURSES wheel the  bloody form of Jason into the room. Two nurses rip open  Jason's shirt, revealing five ghastly BULLET WOUNDS to  his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitals! Get me four units of O- neg  blood and start IV infusion! Nurses start hooking Jason to IV tubes. The doctor  examines Jason's bloody chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need chest, spine and abdominal X- rays -- now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off instruments)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood pressure -- ninety over sixty  and falling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... get an arterial line going...  and set up a dopamine drip -- four  hundred milligrams. This guy's going  to surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short time later. Jason on the operating table, a  SURGEON, an ASSISTANT, an ANESTHESIOLOGIST and various  NURSES are working furiously. Jason is still hooked to IV tubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking over Jason)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this guy's still  breathing. Multiple gunshot wounds to  the upper thorax... massive tissue  injury... (to anesthesiologist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's put him under.  The anesthesiologist takes a syringe full of fluid and  INJECTS it into a port in the IV tubing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jason)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Buddy. Just start counting  backwards from a hundred. One  hundred... ninety-nine... ninety- eight... The surgeon is strapping on gloves... the assistant and  nurse are wheeling in carts of scalpels, clamps, surgical gauze.  The surgeon is ready to go -- but Jason's eyes are still  open and he's wide awake, watching him. It's a creepy  sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to anesthesiologist)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Get him under! The anesthesiologist looks baffled -- injects a _second  dose_ of the fluid into Jason's IV. But Jason doesn't  flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying, Doctor... but if I give  this guy any more barbiturates, it's  gonna kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't go in now, he's going to  bleed to death. Do what it takes.  The anesthesiologist grabs a nearby GAS MASK and puts it  over Jason's mouth. He spins the wheel on a tank labeled  NITROUS OXIDE -- we see the level indicator on the tank  rise... rise... all the way to a _hundred percent_.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jason)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come        on, damn you... close your  eyes... _go to sleep_... As he says this, we CLOSE IN on Jason's face... and  finally, his eyelids begin to droop... and slowly _close_. At that moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the blackness of the screen, we hear the sound of  THUNDER. A FLASH of LIGHTNING jolts across the blackness, and we realize that we're in --

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S DREAM
dialogues.text: as a jagged bolt of LIGHTNING crashes'across the angry  heavens. CAMERA TILTS DOWN to find a YOUNG BOY, age  eleven, running through a DARK FOREST in terror.  THIS IS JASON VOORHEES AS A BOY. Something's chasing him, and he keeps glancing back. The boy is covered with  bruises and nasty looking scratches on his face. He  stumbles, falls, hits the ground hard.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHCUTS
dialogues.text: -- JASON'S MOTHER laughing, her face bathed in soft  candlelight. -- A HAND massaging a woman's breast.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOY
dialogues.text: Stumbles to his feet in the forest, continues his flight. Tree branches and bushes slap at his face as he runs  through the forest, scratching him, tearing at his  clothes.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHCUTS
dialogues.text: -- A bedroom door slowly opening.  -- Jason's mother's face looking up in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOY
dialogues.text: Leans up against a tree, tries to catch his breath.  Suddenly we hear a deep and terrible VOICE calling out  across the forest. FREDDY KRUEGER'S VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are you, little man! The boy runs harder, loses his footing and falls down an  embankment. As he falls through the air...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHCUTS
dialogues.text: -- The boy standing in a room'as a man's hand reaches  down for him.  -- Jason's mother laughing.  -- The boy being slammed against a wall.  -- Lightening crashing against the sky.  -- Lightening on the _unburned_ face of Freddy Krueger,  smiling.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOY
dialogues.text: HITS the bottom of the embankment hard, knocking the wind out of him. He gets to his hands and knees, tries to draw in a breath, but it's impossible. Again Freddy's voice  booms out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been a very naughty boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The operation is under way. Jason's chest is OPEN and the surgeon is removing a large caliber bullet with a pair of forceps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: bullet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a .45 to me. He drops the bullet in a pan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... this one's lodged near  the spinal column... The Surgeon glances up at a FLUOROSCOPIC MONITOR which  shows a black and white image of the surgeon's tools and  the interior of Jason's chest -- it looks like a real- time X-ray image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a clamp... retract the lung... On the monitor, we can see the progress as the forceps  and clamps get closer to a bullet. The surgeon probes for the bullet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching monitor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy... almost got it...  The surgeon's concentrating... everyone's being very  still...  Jason's HAND flies up and grabs the doctor by the neck!  Everyone reacts in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: _Jesus_! Jason's eyes are still closed, but he's stirring as  though having a nightmare and trying to wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His heart rate's jumped to one-ninety- nine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sedative! A nurse injects Jason with a hypo. He stops struggling  and his hand drops away from the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S DREAM
dialogues.text: CRYSTAL LAKE. The sky is dark with storm clouds. The boy  comes tearing out of the forest, scratched, bedraggled,  terrified. He stops at the SHORE to the lake, looks  around in desperation. He's trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming! The boy spots a METAL CANOE a ways down the shoreline. He runs to it, jumps inside, shoves off onto the water and  begins paddling like mad to get away from the beach.  He glances back at the shore... nothing. It looks like he got away. He stops paddling for a moment, tries to catch  his breath.  There is the SLITHERING SCRAPE of metal under the boat.  The boy freezes and looks around. _Something is under the boat_. The scratching gets LOUDER, as if someone were  trying to claw their way through. Suddenly, it stops.  Silence.  The CANOE CAPSIZES -- the boy is thrown into the cold  water. He flails in panic... he can't swim...  tries to clutch onto the overturned boat... finally  manages to hang on and keep himself from going under. But then, without warning... something PULLS HIM DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy is thrashing to get back to the surface, but he  just keeps going deeper... deeper into the murk...  The boy looks up and reacts to something --  The sudden flash of. FREDDY'S METAL FINGER BLADES flies  toward the boy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason starts to convulse on the table. The surgeon is in  the middle of closing the wounds... Jason jumps a little  and the Surgeon accidentally STABS his own hand with the  needle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stabilize him, goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood pressure rising!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going into epileptic convulsions! Jason is thrashing on the table, knocking over equipment. He lashes out at a Nurse, connecting with her chest and  sending her FLYING across the room. The doctors and  nurses struggle to hold him down. Suddenly one of the nurses glancing up at the  fluoroscopic monitor...

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: The fluoroscopic scanner still shows the interior of  Jason's chest, but for a moment the silhouette of  _FREDDY'S FINGER BLADES_ pass across the screen as if  moving through Jason's chest cavity.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME NURSE
dialogues.text: who reacts with stunned surprise.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: his eyes fly OPEN and he's awake. At that moment, he  stops struggling and simply lies        calmly on the ope table. A long beat as everyone in the room stands back  and watches him, not knowing what to expect next. Off the shocking moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby, Sena, Kwan, Harding, and Sheriff Hayes are all  waiting for word. The surgeon comes into the room with a  shell-shocked and bewildered look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's... going to make a full recovery. Surprised looks go around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding. The guy took five  shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was touch and go there for a while.  He suffered convulsions at one  point... and then he went into cardiac  arrest. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, some things happened in that  operating room that I just don't know  how to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, to start with the man has an  incredible metabolism. His heart rate  is about one-eighty -- and that seems  to be normal for him. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't even want to talk about  his EEG. It's so bizarre I'm thinking  of sending it to Johns Hopkins for  analysis. Sena points to the clipboard the surgeon's holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that his file?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of it. When I've completed my  post-op report, I'll add it to the  rest of his file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, the rest of his  file?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to our records, we have  medical files on Jason... his  mother... his whole family. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haven't been added to the  computer database yet, but they're  still down in the basement.  As Ruby and Sena exchange a look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby and Sena are walking through the rows and rows of  shelves of medical records. An attractive NURSE is  leading them to a specific shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voorhees... Voorhees... right here. She pulls out three file folders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pamela Voorhees... Elias Voorhees...  here we are... _Jason_. (flipping through folder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not much. Birth Certificate...  a few office visits. Nothing after  1967.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I take a look? The nurse hands her the files, hands the other half to  Sena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be up front if you need me. Sena stares after the nurse with an appreciative leer. As they flip through the file folders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurses. That's why I went into  medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sexual obsession of yours. Have  you considered going into therapy  yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need. I'm self-diagnosed. I have  severe nympholepsy... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm a bed-wetter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I definitely feel sorry for you. (reading from case file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: August fourteenth, 1956... Jason was  brought in by his mother, who said the  boy hadn't slept for two weeks. Doctor  prescribed Valium... She flips to another page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading, shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. Jason's mother  died of ovarian cancer in 1969.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought she was a killer, too. You  know... that she chopped up a bunch of  teenage camp counselors... before she  was decapitated. Ruby is annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the problem with this case.  Everyone thinks they know Jason's life  story. But they don't. What you're  remembering is a _movie_. Fiction.        In  the movie, Jason's mother runs around,  killing people after Jason drowns in  Crystal Lake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of that's true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Jason _was_ in a canoe accident  in 1967 and presumed drowned. His  mother died a few years later after a  long bout with cancer. Some time in  the early eighties, there were a  string of murders out by Crystal  Lake... (spooky voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People started saying it was Jason...  back from the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what are you saying... that he  didn't kill all those people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job is not to determine his guilt  or innocence. That's up to the jury.  My job is defend him.  Sena gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice bit of lawyer-speak. Why  don't you just say it -- your client's  a psychotic killer who's murdered  dozens of people, and you're trying to  set him free. Right? She gives him a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing, casual)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong. I don't care. But  the professional part of me is  interested in how you rationalize what  you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't "rationalize" anything. I'm  his lawyer -- he's my client. That's  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That didn't sound very convincing. Ruby looks at him squarely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want -- a tidy  psychological profile? You want to  hear that I was falsely accused of a  crime I didn't commit... and that's  driven me to defend others? Or maybe  you want to me to get in touch with my  feelings... talk about my childhood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You've told me all I need to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're obviously going through a  critical moral dilemma. And you're  putting up barriers against anyone who  tries to probe your conscience. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is heartening to know that you  do have a conscience.  There's a beat. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you charging me your hourly rate  right now? He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That was a freebie.  She looks at the file again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much here. Jason was brought in a  couple more times for insomnia...  that's about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Let me see that. She  hands him the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother said the boy hadn't slept  for over three _months_. A physical  examination showed dilated pupils,  temperature of one-oh-two, blood  chemistry highly imbalanced...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty weird. Is it possible  for someone to not sleep for months?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's rare... but there are cases where  people go for years without sleep. (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They diagnosed Jason with simple  insomnia... but that's not what it  looks like to me. He has every  indication of having _insomnolesence_.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insomnolesence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a neurological disorder affecting  the hypothalamus. The part of the  brain that causes sleepiness is  inactive. They didn't know about it  back in the sixties. Even now, it's  not understood very well. Ruby considers, intrigued by this new revelation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Jason doesn't sleep... how does  that help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insomnolesence has been known to cause  psychotic episodes... delusions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we could prove that Jason suffers  from this disorder... and that his  homicidal behavior has been a direct  result of a medical condition...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not guilty by reason of insanity. Case  closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we prove it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple. We sedate him, induce a  somnolesent state, and study his REM  patterns when he's unconscious. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he has the disorder, his REMS will  be highly abnormal. Ruby smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'd say it's bedtime for Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is lying on a bed, strapped down and shackled to  the bed frame. Various pieces of medical equipment are  nearby. An IV is hooked to Jason's arm. There are bars on the window and an armed DEPUTY stands by the door. Jason  is conscious and staring at the ceiling with his usual  stark gaze.  Ruby and Kwan look on as Sena attaches sensor pads to  Jason's forehead. The pads have long electrical cords  which are connected in turn to a CONSOLE which has been  wheeled into the room. The console has monitors and  controls on it. Sena's assistant, LAYTON, is running various tests on the equipment. Sena puts the last sensor pad in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... that'll do it. All of the  contacts are in place. (to Layton)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begin recording. Layton taps a few controls on the console, looks at a  monitor which displays various GRAPHS and BRAIN PATTERN  schematics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off console)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything looks good. I'm getting  EEG... encephalitic levels... neuro- electrical readings... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start recording-at twenty-thirty  hours.  He taps a control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will he need to be asleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to need at least two full  REM cycles to get a clear neurological  profile. Three hours minimum, six  hours ideal. Ruby moves to the bed, looks down at Jason. She's still  nervous around him, her feelings mixed about this brutal  serial killer. But she does her best to put on a  professional face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason... we're going to put you to  sleep now. We're going to run some  tests. But it's going to be all right.  Just trust me. No response from Jason. Ruby looks at Sena, nods. Sena  takes a syringe from an adjacent table... then hooks it  into the IV. Kwan is noting everything on a legal pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the record, what kind of sedative  are you using?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-seven CC's Valium. Sena's assistant looks up in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-seven CC's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, but believe me -- this  guy doesn't go under very easily. Sena injects the full syringe into the IV. They step  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ruby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's it. He'll be asleep in a  few minutes, but his first REM-cycle  probably won't kick in for another  hour or so. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a place we can get something  to eat in this town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pizza place over on Market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute waitresses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's open to debate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take my chances. Come on, I'm  buying. She shakes her head, pulls up a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to see here. He  sleeps... we record it. That's all  that happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my client, and this is important.  Enjoy your waitresses.  Sena shrugs and then exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kwan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take note of everything that happens,  no matter how insignificant. I want a  complete record of this for the court.  Kwan nods, sits, taking his job very seriously. Layton  looks over at them and yawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're lucky, maybe he'll fart in  his sleep. Kwan smiles, but then sees Ruby isn't amused. She keeps  her eyes on Jason. OFF the image of Jason's face -- his  eyes are drooping and he's-starting to fall asleep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few cars in the parking lot, and some extra sheriff's  deputies providing security -- but otherwise, all is  quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A while later. Layton is sitting at the console, watching the monitor with a bored look. Kwan is doodling on the  legal pad. The Deputy is slouching against the wall.  Jason is sleeping. Only Ruby seems still interested in  Jason -- she watches him closely. A quiet moment, then  Ruby looks up, catching something out of the corner of  her eye...

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S HAND
dialogues.text: His finger twitches slightly.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S EYES
dialogues.text: His eyes begin to move back and forth beneath his  eyelids...

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Layton reacts as his console sends out a BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off console)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he goes. REM sleep began at  twenty-two fifteen hours. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams, you psycho.  On the monitor, we see the distinctive EEG of REM SLEEP - a single squiggly line. There's also a hard copy print- out being generated off to the side on a long, narrow  sheet of paper piling up on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S FACE
dialogues.text: Eyes shifting under closed lids -- Rapid Eye Movement.  PUSH IN ON Jason's eyes... closer, until they fill the  frame... Suddenly his eyes fly open, and we PULL BACK to reveal  that we are actually looking at eyes of the YOUNG JASON  seen in the earlier dream sequence. _WE ARE IN JASON'S  DREAM_. The boy is lying wide awake on his bed, staring  up at the bedroom ceiling, unable to sleep.  The boy hears a distant screaming noise... the moans of a woman's voice. It sounds like she's in pain. The boy  frowns, climbs off his bed and follows the sound into the nearby hallway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of the dilapidated, abandoned house seen earlier, the house is in fine condition, filled with normal  furniture and has a lived-in look. We're in Jason's house as it appeared over twenty years ago. The young boy,  scared, worried, is walking toward the bedroom door at  the end of the hall. The moans and screams grow louder.  He finally reaches the door and slowly opens it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom seen earlier, but as it appeared over twenty  years ago. A woman is tied to the bed with leather straps and she's screaming in ecstasy. A man is on top of her,  fucking her hard enough to make the bed slam against the  wall.  Young Jason stands in the doorway, wide-eyed, not sure  what to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy? The woman looks over, sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Jason... what are you  doing? Get out of here! The man turns his head to the boy in anger -- it's FREDDY KRUEGER as he appeared when he was mortal -- no burns.  He's naked but the distinctive fedora sits on a nearby  chair.
